page.title: 19SHALE BINGS
page.content: Wherever you go in and around The Breich Valley you can't help noticing large mounds of red stonewhich are a symbol of the former prosperity of the area.They are bings of shale stone.They are the remains of the oil bearing shale rock which was mined in the area until the early sixties when it became unprofitable.After it was dug up the rock underwent a number of processes until all the oil was taken out.The stone that was left over was thrown into a heap which just grew and grew into the large mounds which dominate the landscape today.Some of these bings are now beginning to disappear however because builders have found that the stone is useful as a foundation for road and pavement building.
